text.p: Commercial Metals Co said Monday it had authorized the repurchase of up to 500,000 additional shares of the company's common stock.
The company now has authority to purchase a total of 712,374 shares, including 212,374 remaining from prior authorizations.

Purchases will be made from time to time in the open market or in privately negotiated transactions at prevailing market prices. The shares will be used for general corporate purposes, including various employee benefit plans and acquisitions. At present there are about 14.8 million shares outstanding.
Over the past two years, Commercial Metals has repurchased about 1.05 million shares, including 497,500 purchased during the last month, with an average per share cost of $28.34 for recent purchases.
Commercial Metals makes steel and metal products, related materials and services. It was down 1/8 to 27-1/4 early Monday.
